scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is introducing Phoebe, who is playing her guitar for the
crowd.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Everybody? Shh, shhh. Uhhh... Central Perk is proud to present the music of Miss Phoebe Buffay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi. Um, I want to start with a song thats about that moment when you suddenly realize what life is all about. OK, here we go. (plays a chord, then the lights go out) OK, thank you very much.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is introducing Phoebe, who is playing her guitar for the
crowd.]

events.event_description: Rachel introduces Phoebe to the crowd.
Phoebe starts her song and plays a chord, after which the lights go out.
Phoebe thanks the crowd after her performance.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The ATM vestibule of a bank, Chandler is inside. The lights go out, and he
realizes he is trapped inside.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, great . This is just...

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The ATM vestibule of a bank, Chandler is inside. The lights go out, and he
realizes he is trapped inside.]

events.event_description: The lights in the ATM vestibule go out, causing Chandler to realize he is trapped inside.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is on the phone with her mother. Phoebe, Rachel,
and Ross are there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow, this is so cool, you guys. The entire city is blacked out!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mom says it's all of Manhattan, parts of Brooklyn and Queens, and they have no idea when it's coming back on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow, you guys, this is big.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (into phone) Pants and a sweater? Why, mom? Who am I gonna meet in a blackout? Power company guys? Eligible looters? Could we talk about this later? OK. (hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Can I borrow the phone? I want to call my apartment and check on my grandma. (to Monica) What's my number?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I never call me .

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is on the phone with her mother. Phoebe, Rachel,
and Ross are there.]

events.event_description: Rachel announces the blackout.
Monica provides details about the blackout's extent.
Rachel reacts to the blackout information.
Monica hangs up the phone after talking to her mother.
Phoebe requests to borrow the phone to check on her grandma.
Phoebe makes a statement about not calling herself.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: ATM vestibule, Jill Goodacre is on the cellular phone. Chandler's thoughts are
in italics.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh my God, it's that Victoria's Secret model. Something... something Goodacre.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hi Mom, it's Jill.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She's right, it's Jill. Jill Goodacre. Oh my God. I am trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre! (pause) Is it a vestibule? Maybe it's an atrium. Oh, yeah, that is the part to focus on, you idiot!

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, I'm fine. I'm just stuck at the bank, in an ATM vestibule.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Jill says vestibule... I'm going with vestibule.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: (on phone) I'm fine. No, I'm not alone... I don't know, some guy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh! Some guy. Some guy. 'Hey Jill, I saw you with some guy last night. Yes, he was some guy .

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: ATM vestibule, Jill Goodacre is on the cellular phone. Chandler's thoughts are
in italics.]

events.event_description: Chandler recognizes Jill as Jill Goodacre.
Chandler debates whether the location is a vestibule or atrium.
Jill calls her mother and mentions being stuck at the bank in an ATM vestibule.
Chandler reacts to Jill's mention of being with 'some guy'.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's apartment, Joey enters with a menorah, the candles lit.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi everyone.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And officiating at tonight's blackout, is Rabbi Tribbiani.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, Chandler's old roomate was Jewish, and these are the only candles we have, so... Happy Chanukah, everyone.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (at window) Eww, look. Ugly Naked Guy lit a bunch of candles.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That had to hurt!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica's apartment, Joey enters with a menorah, the candles lit.]

events.event_description: Joey enters Monica's apartment with a menorah, with the candles lit.
Ross jokes about officiating the blackout as Rabbi Tribbiani.
Joey explains the origin of the menorah and wishes everyone a Happy Chanukah.
Phoebe points out that the Ugly Naked Guy lit candles.
Rachel comments that it must have hurt for the Ugly Naked Guy to light the candles.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, alright. It's been fourteen and a half minutes and you still have not said one word. Oh God, do something. Just make contact, smile!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There you go!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're definitely scaring here.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: (awkwardly) Would you like to call somebody? (offering phone)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, about 300 guys I went to high school with. Yeah, thanks. (takes phone)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

events.event_description: Chandler expresses frustration and urges Jill to make contact or smile.
Chandler acknowledges Jill's contact with a comment.
Chandler comments on Jill's behavior, suggesting she is still scary.
Jill awkwardly offers her phone to Chandler.
Chandler takes the phone and humorously mentions calling 300 high school friends.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The phone rings; it's Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, it's me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to everyone) It's Chandler! (on phone) Are you OK?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm fine. (trying to cover up what he is saying) I'm trppd in an ATM vstbl wth Jll Gdcr .

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm trppd... in an ATM vstbl... wth Jll Gdcr !

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I have no idea what you just said.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (angry) Put Joey on the phone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's up man?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm trppd... in an ATM vstbl... wth JLL GDCR .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to everyone) Oh my God! He's trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre! (on phone) Chandler, listen. (says something intentionally garbled)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, like that thought never entered my mind.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The phone rings; it's Chandler.]

events.event_description: Monica answers the phone and informs everyone it's Chandler.
Chandler explains he is 'trppd in an ATM vstbl wth Jll Gdcr' to Monica.
Monica expresses confusion about Chandler's message.
Chandler becomes frustrated and asks Monica to put Joey on the phone.
Joey takes the phone and speaks to Chandler, attempting to understand his situation.
Joey informs the others that Chandler is trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre.
Chandler responds to Joey's comment, indicating frustration.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time has passed. The five are sitting around the coffee
table talking.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright, somebody.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, I'll go. OK, senior year of college... on a pool table.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Whoooaa!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's my sister.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: OK... my weirdest place would have to be... the women's room on the second floor of the New York CIty public library.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! What were you doing in a library?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, what about you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh... Milwaukee.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um... Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Disneyland, 1989, 'It's a Small World After All.'

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: No way!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The ride broke down. So, Carol and I went behind a couple of those mechanical Dutch children... then they fixed the ride, and we were asked never to return to the Magic Kingdom.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh come on, I already went.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You did not go!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Come on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, alright. The weirdest place would have to be... (sigh)... oh, the foot of the bed.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Step back.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We have a winner!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I just never had a relationship with that kind of passion, you know, where you have to have somebody right there, in the middle of a theme park.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, it was the only thing to do there that didn't have a line.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: There, well, see? Barry wouldn't even kiss me on a miniature golf course.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, he said we were holding up the people behind us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) And you didn't marry him because...?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean, do you think there are people who go through life never having that kind of...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Probably. But you know, I'll tell you something. Passion is way overrated.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It is. Eventually, it kind of... burns out. But hopefully, what you're left with is trust, and security, and... well, in the case of my ex-wife, lesbianism. So, you know, for all of those people who miss out on that passion... thing, there's all that other good stuff.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sigh) OK.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But, um... I don't think that's going to be you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You don't.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh-uh. See, I see.... big passion in your future.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mmmm.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh Ross, you're so great. (she playfully rubs his head and gets up)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's never gonna happen.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (innocently) What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You and Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (acts surprised) What? (pause) Why not?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Because you waited too long to make your move, and now you're in the friend zone .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, no. I'm not in the zone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ross, you're mayor of the zone.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm taking my time, alright? I'm laying the groundwork. Yeah. I mean, every day I get just a little bit closer to...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Priesthood! Look Ross, I'm telling you, she has no idea what you're thinking. If you don't ask her out soon you're going to end up stuck in the zone forever.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I will, I will. See, I'm waiting for the right moment. (Joey looks at him) What? What, now?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeeeeaaaahhh! What's messing you up? The wine? The candles? The moonlight? You've just got to go up to her and say, 'Rachel, I think that...' (Rachel comes into the room behind them)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Shhhh!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you shushing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're shushing... because... we're trying to hear something. Listen. (everyone is silent) Don't you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ahhhh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: See?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Huh. (she agrees, but looks very confused)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time has passed. The five are sitting around the coffee
table talking.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Would you like some gum?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Um, is it sugarless?

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: (checks) Sorry, it's not.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, then no thanks. What the hell was that?

dialogue.speaker: MENTAL NOTE
dialogue.text: If Jill Goodacre offers you gum, you take it. If she offers you mangled animal carcass, you take it.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

events.event_description: JILL offers gum to Chandler.
CHANDLER asks if the gum is sugarless.
CHANDLER declines the gum after discovering it is sugary.
MENTAL NOTE provides a cryptic instruction about accepting offerings from Jill Goodacre.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's apartment, Phoebe is singing.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) New York City has no power, and the milk is getting sour. But to me it is not scary, 'cause I stay away from dairy.... la la la, la la, la la... (she writes the lyrics down)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Joey) OK, here goes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Are you going to do it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm going to do it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do you want any help?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You come out there, you're a dead man.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Good luck, man.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks. (Joey hugs him) OK.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: OK. (Ross goes out on the balcony to talk to Rachel)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, where are you going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Outside.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You can't go out there.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Because of... the reason.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And that would be?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I, um, can't tell you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: OK, you've got to promise that you'll never, ever tell Ross that I told you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He's planning your birthday party.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! I love him!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (as Phoebe enters) You'd better act surprised.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: My surprise party!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What surprise party?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh stop it. Joey already told me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he didn't tell me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, don't look at me. This is Ross's thing.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is so typical. I'm always the last one to know everything.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, you are not. We tell you stuff.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yuh-huh! I was the last one to know when Chandler got bitten by the peacock at the zoo. I was the last one to know when you had a crush on Joey when he was moving in. (Monica gestures at Phoebe to shut up; Joey looks surprised but pleased) Looks like I was second to last.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica's apartment, Phoebe is singing.]

events.event_description: Phoebe sings and writes lyrics about a song.
Ross informs Joey he is going to do something.
Joey warns Ross that coming out would make him a dead man.
Ross exits to talk to Rachel on the balcony.
Joey questions Monica about her intention to go outside.
Monica asks Joey why she cannot go outside, and Joey refuses to disclose the reason.
Joey makes Monica promise not to tell Ross about his plan.
Monica inquires about the secret plan, and Joey reveals it is about Ross planning her birthday party.
Phoebe enters the conversation, and Monica mentions a surprise party.
Phoebe expresses frustration about always being the last to know things, citing examples.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Ross and Rachel are talking.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hmmm... this is so nice.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, I have a question. Well, actually, it's not so much a question as.. more of a general wondering... ment.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK. Here goes. For a while now, I've been wanting to, um....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohhh!!!! (looking at something behind Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, that's right...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, look at the little cat! (a small kitten is on the roof behind Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? (the cat jumps on his shoulders) Ow!

dialogue.speaker: AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) I'm on top of the world, looking down on creation and the only explanation I can find, is the wonders I've found ever since...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Ross and Rachel are talking.]

events.event_description: Rachel expresses her enjoyment of the current situation.
Ross begins to express a general wondering or question.
Rachel reacts to seeing a kitten behind Ross.
Ross is surprised and reacts to the kitten jumping on his shoulders.
Phoebe starts singing a song about being on top of the world.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is holding the cat, Monica is treating the
scratches on Ross' back. Joey is holding the menorah over the wound.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Ross) This is just Bactine. It won't hurt.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sorry, that was wax.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, poor little Tooty is scared to death. We should find his owner.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why don't we just put 'poor little Tooty' out in the hall?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: During a blackout? He'd get trampled!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (nonchalantly) Yeah?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is holding the cat, Monica is treating the
scratches on Ross' back. Joey is holding the menorah over the wound.]

events.event_description: Monica applies Bactine to Ross' back.
Joey apologizes for the wax burn.
Phoebe comforts the cat, Tooty.
Ross suggests putting the cat in the hall.
Rachel objects to putting the cat in the hall during a blackout.
Ross dismisses Rachel's concern about the cat's safety.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, on second thought, gum would be perfection. (Jill gives him a stick of gum, and a strange look) 'Gum would be perfection'? 'Gum would be perfection.' Could have said 'gum would be nice,' or 'I'll have a stick,' but no, no, no, no. For me, gum is perfection . I loathe myself.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

events.event_description: Chandler comments on gum being perfection.
Jill gives Chandler a stick of gum.
Jill gives Chandler a strange look.
Chandler repeats his statement about gum being perfection.
Chandler criticizes his choice of words.
Chandler expresses self-loathing.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The hallway of Monica's building. Phoebe and Rachel are trying to find the
cat's owner.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (stops at a door) Oh no, the Mendels, they hate all living things, right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. (they knock at the next door, Mr. Heckles answers) Hi. We just found this cat and we're looking for the owner.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Er, yeah, it's mine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (trying to hold back the struggling cat) He seems to hate you. Are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's my cat. Give me my cat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait a minute. What's his name?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Ehhhh... B-Buttons.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bob Buttons?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Mmm. Bob Buttons. Here, Bob Buttons.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (the cat runs away from her) Oooh! You are a very bad man!

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: (as Phoebe and Rachel leave) You owe me a cat.

scenes.location:
The hallway of Monica's building. Phoebe and Rachel are trying to find the
cat's owner.
scenes.context_label:
0107_scene_013_The hallway of Monica's building. Phoebe and Rachel are trying to find the
cat's owner.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The hallway of Monica's building. Phoebe and Rachel are trying to find the
cat's owner.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Here, kitty-kitty. Here kitty-kitty. Where did you go, little kitty-kitty-kitty? Here kitty-kitty-kitty-kitty...

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: (something Italian)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow. (she exhales in amazement, blowing the candle out)

scenes.location: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.
scenes.context_label: 0107_scene_014_Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.]

events.event_description: Rachel calls out to the cat repeatedly, attempting to locate it.
events.location: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.

events.event_description: Paolo speaks in Italian.
events.location: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.

events.event_description: Rachel reacts with surprise, saying 'Wow,' and blows out a candle.
events.location: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat's owner.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross, Monica, and Joey are playing Monopoly .]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (rolling) Lucky sixes....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering with Paolo, arm in arm) Everybody, this is Paolo. Paolo, I want you to meet my friends. This is Monica.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (smitten) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And Joey....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And Ross.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: (something in Italian)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (proudly) He doesn't speak much English.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: (pointing at game) Monopoly !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look at that!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (jealous) So, um... where did Paolo come from?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh... Italy, I think.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I mean tonight, in the building. Suddenly. Into our lives.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, the cat... the cat turned out to be Paolo's cat!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That, that is funny... (to Joey).... and Rachel keeps touching him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Alright. I looked all over the building and I couldn't find the kitty anywhere.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I found him. He was Paolo's cat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ah! Well! There you go! Last to know again! And I'm guessing... since nobody told me... this is Paolo.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ah, Paolo, this is Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: (something in Italian, he is apparently attracted to Phoebe)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (smiling) You betcha!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross, Monica, and Joey are playing Monopoly .]

events.event_description: Ross rolls the dice and exclaims 'Lucky sixes.'
Rachel enters with Paolo and introduces him to Monica, Ross, and Joey.
Paolo speaks in Italian, and Rachel mentions he doesn't speak much English.
Paolo points at the Monopoly game and says 'Monopoly!' in Italian.
Ross expresses jealousy and asks where Paolo came from.
Rachel explains that Paolo is from Italy and mentions the cat incident.
Phoebe enters, having searched for the cat, and learns about Paolo.
Phoebe realizes the cat was Paolo's and interacts with him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (chewing gum) Ah, let's see. What next? Blow a bubble. A bubble's good. It's got a... boyish charm, it's impish. Here we go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nice going, imp. OK, it's OK. All I need to do is reach over and put it in my mouth. (Chandler slyly grabs the gum from the wall and slides it back in his mouth.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Good save! We're back on track, and I'm... (grimacing) ..chewing someone else's gum. This is not my gum . Oh my God! Oh my God! And now you're choking.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: My God, you're choking! (she runs over and gives him the Heimlich, the gum flies from his mouth) That better?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (gasping) Yes... thank you. That was... that was....

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Perfection?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule.]

events.event_description: Chandler blows a bubble while chewing gum.
Chandler slyly grabs the gum from the wall and slides it back into his mouth.
Chandler chokes on someone else's gum.
Jill asks if Chandler is alright.
Jill runs over to Chandler and performs the Heimlich maneuver, causing the gum to fly from his mouth.
Chandler gasps and thanks Jill for her assistance.
Jill compliments her own action as 'perfection'.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Paolo are at the window. Ross and Joey are
watching disgustedly.]

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: (something romantic in Italian about Rachel and the stars)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (mocking Paolo) Blah blah blah, blah blah blah... blah blaaaaaah....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wha-What did he say that was so funny?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I have absolutely no idea.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's... that's classic.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Monica and Phoebe) Oh my God, you guys, what am I doing? What am I doing? This is so un-me!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: If you want, I'll do it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know, I just want to bite his bottom lip. (Rachel looks at her) But I won't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God, the first time he smiled at me... those three seconds were more exciting than three weeks in Bermuda with Barry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, did you ride mopeds? 'Cause I've heard... (they stare at her)... oh, I see... it's not about that right now. OK.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, I know it's totally superficial and we have absolutely nothing in common, and we don't even speak the same language but Goooooooddddddd....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Paolo. Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen. Um, listen. Something you should... know... um, Rachel and I... we're kind of a thing.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Thing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thing, yes. Thing.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Ah, you... have the sex?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, no. Technically the... sex is not... being had, but that's... see, that's not the point. See, um, the point is that... Rachel and I should be, er, together. You know, and if you get in the.... um...

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Bed?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, that's not where I was going. Er, if you get in the... way , of us becoming a thing, then I would be, well, very sad.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah! Se vice ?

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Si.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So you do know a little English.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Poco... a leetle.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Do you know the word crapweasel ?

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's funny, because you know, you are a huge crapweasel!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Paolo are at the window. Ross and Joey are
watching disgustedly.]

events.event_description: Paolo makes a romantic statement about Rachel and the stars in Italian.
Ross mocks Paolo's romantic statement.
Ross asks Rachel what Paolo said that was funny.
Ross comments that the situation is 'classic'.
Rachel expresses confusion and frustration about her actions with Paolo.
Phoebe jokes about wanting to bite Paolo's bottom lip but refrains.
Rachel reminisces about the first time Paolo smiled at her.
Phoebe brings up moped riding but realizes it's irrelevant.
Rachel confesses her strong feelings for Paolo despite their differences.
Ross warns Paolo about getting in the way of his relationship with Rachel.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: ATM vestibule, Chandler and Jill are sitting below the counter with two pens
dangling from their chains in front of them. Jill is showing Chandler how to swing the pen
around his head.]

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Chandler, we've been here for an hour doing this! Now watch, it's easy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: OK.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Ready? (she swings the pen around her head in a circle)

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: No, you've got to whip it.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: ATM vestibule, Chandler and Jill are sitting below the counter with two pens
dangling from their chains in front of them. Jill is showing Chandler how to swing the pen
around his head.]

events.event_description: Jill demonstrates swinging the pen around her head in a circle.
Jill instructs Chandler to watch how to swing the pen.
Chandler attempts to swing the pen around his head after Jill's demonstration.
Jill corrects Chandler's pen-swinging technique, telling him to 'whip it'.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is all sitting around the table.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look look look. The last candle's about to burn out. 10, 9, 8, 7... (time lapse)... negative 46, negative 47, negative 48.... (someone blows it out, the room gets completely dark)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Kinda... spooky without any lights.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (does a maniacal laugh) Bwah-hah-hah!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, guys, guys? I have the definitive one. Mwwwooooo-hah-hah...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.. oh... oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey Ross. This probably isn't the best time to bring it up, but you have to throw a party for Monica.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is all sitting around the table.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule, the power has come back on.]

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Well, this has been fun.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes. Yes, thanks for letting me use your phone... and for saving my life.

dialogue.speaker: JILL
dialogue.text: Well, goodbye Chandler. I had a great blackout. (she kisses him on the cheek) See ya.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi, um, I'm account number 7143457. And, uh, I don't know if you got any of that, but I would really like a copy of the tape.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: ATM vestibule, the power has come back on.]

events.event_description: Jill expresses that their time together has been fun.
Chandler thanks Jill for letting him use her phone and for saving his life.
Jill says goodbye to Chandler and kisses him on the cheek.
Chandler provides his account number to Jill.
Chandler requests a copy of the tape from Jill.
